business.headline: Sensex ends nearly 450 points higher, Nifty nears life-time highThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 446.21 points to close at 85,632.68, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 139.50 points to finish at 26,192.15. Broader indices were mixed, but the tone across frontline stocks remained firmly positive, led by gains in heavyweight financial counters.

Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty nears life-time high. What's driving the rally?At 1.58 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 526.63 points to 85,713.10, while the NSE Nifty50 hit a fresh 52-week high and was nearing an all-time high of 26,277.

Groww share price falls 10% again: Is the post-listing rally over?Around 1:12 pm, shares of the company were trading 9.18% lower at Rs 154.30. Over the last two sessions, the stock has slipped nearly 18%, a sharp reversal that has investors wondering whether the post-listing rally has already run its course.

Leading e-commerce platforms say they now comply with anti–dark pattern rulesAmong the 26 companies listed by the CCPA are well-known names such as Flipkart, Myntra, Zomato, Swiggy, Meesho, BigBasket, JioMart and others.

The new trade playbook: Why the world needs a more distributed systemThese shifts are not driven by a single factor but by the combined influence of policy changes, supply chain lessons from recent years, and the evolving priorities of businesses and governments.

Investing Rs 5,000 every month in SIPs? This is when you can hit Rs 1 crorePeople know SIPs are useful, they hear stories of long-term gains, and they see friends investing every month, but when it comes to choosing where to put a small amount like Rs 5,000, most feel lost.

ED attaches Anil Ambani-linked assets worth Rs 1,400 crore; total nears Rs 9,000 croreThe latest attachment has been made under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The properties are located across Navi Mumbai, Chennai, Pune and Bhubaneswar, the sources said.

Considering a personal loan for holiday travel? Ask these 5 questions firstFunding that year-end getaway through an instant personal loan might seem like a savvy move, but it is important to assess the need thoroughly. An impulsive decision may be overshadowing some important financial realities.

JP Power share price zooms 10%. Why is it rising today?JP Power, which was trading at Rs 22.37, gained over 10% in early trade as investors reacted to clarity on the future of the JP Group's stressed assets. JAL, the former promoter entity, holds close to 24% stake in JP Power.

Groww shares down 8% again: Why Billionbrains stock is falling todayGroww has been under pressure for two consecutive days. On Wednesday, the stock had already slipped around 10%. This comes after the company made a strong market debut, listing at Rs 112, about 12% higher than its issue price of Rs 100.

Sensex rises over 150 points, Nifty crosses 26,000; Groww shares tumble 7%The S&P BSE Sensex climbed over 150 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 moved past the 26,000 mark, signalling a mildly bullish undertone across the market. Broader indices also edged higher, mirroring gains in frontline stocks.

When missed EMIs become a nightmare: Inside India's loan harassment trapBehind India's digital lending rise is a quieter story of calls, pressure and fear. Data suggests that loan recovery harassment is growing at a pace the system can no longer keep up with.
Sensex ends 500 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; HCLTech gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 513.45 points to close at 85,186.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 142.60 points to end at 26,052.65.

Big fat Indian weddings can now be insured. Should you get one?India is gearing up for one of its busiest wedding seasons ever. In 2025 alone, nearly 46 lakh weddings are expected, generating close to Rs 6.5 lakh crore in spending.

He lost Rs 40,000: Expert explains how online gaming apps trap usersExpert says insiders from gaming firms have revealed how these apps operate. They label heavy spenders as "whales" and have teams calling them daily to push more deposits.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPExcelsoft Technologies aims to raise Rs 500 crore through the IPO, which includes a fresh issue of 1.50 crore shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.67 crore shares worth Rs 320 crore.

Wrong member ID linked to your UAN? Here's how EPFO lets you fix itMany employees discover that their UAN has been linked to a wrong member ID, often due to job changes or data errors. EPFO has introduced an easy online method to fix this, without visiting any office.

How every day micro-payments eat into your savingsWelcome to India's new spending reality, the age of micro-payments that silently seep into your accounts and cause invisible leaks. By the end of the month, many people find their digital wallets, likePaytm, PhonePe, Google Pay, have quietly leaked hundreds and thousands of rupees.

NCR office rents are rising: What's driving commercial real estate prices up?Expressway expansions, metro lines, and upcoming airports are easing mobility while opening new economic opportunities in the NCR.

Groww shares crash 10% to hit lower circuit. Why are investors booking profits?The share price of Groww fell 10% in early trade and slipped straight to the lower circuit, a sharp contrast to the over 90% rally investors had witnessed over the past few days.

entertainment.headline: Shark Tank India 5: Ghazal Alag introduces husband Varun as new judge Ghazal Alagh's husband Varun Alagh, CEO and Co-founder of Honasa Consumer, joins the investor panel on 'Shark Tank India Season 5', promising to support innovation and startups with his extensive experience in building successful consumer brands.

Who is Shah Rukh Khan? People could ask in 2050: Vivek Oberoi Vivek Oberoi feels Shah Rukh Khan's legacy may fade by 2050. He says future generations may not know of today's superstars in the same way present-day youngsters might not be aware of Raj Kapoor.

Sunjay Kapur's sister says he never treated Karisma badly, just had a bad divorce Mandhira Kapur opens up about the family's legal battles and emotional turmoil after Sunjay Kapur's death, addressing claims involving her brother's divorce with actor Karisma Kapoor.

Prime Video, ZEE5, JioHotstar: Top OTT releases this week This week's OTT lineup delivers a powerful mix of thrillers, historical drama, romance, and returning fan-favourite franchises across Prime Video, ZEE5, and JioHotstar. From Julia Roberts' 'After The Hunt' to 'The Family Man 3', viewers can expect a packed slate of gripping stories.

120 Bahadur review: Farhan Akhtar-led war drama salutes bravery but lacks impactRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025 120 Bahadur movie review: '120 Bahadur' attempts to honour the bravery of soldiers at Rezang La during the 1962 Indo-China war. Despite sincere performances and stunning visuals, the film falls short of delivering a deeply moving war drama.

Netflix this week: Homebound, Dining With The Kapoors and more Netflix's latest weekly lineup offers a mix of powerful dramas, heartfelt stories, and celebrity-led specials, including 'Homebound', 'Train Dreams', 'Bison', and 'Dining With The Kapoors'. With fresh films, series returns, and unique music experiences, the platform brings something for every mood this week.
Korean power couple Shin Min-ah and Kim Woo-bin to wed in December. See date here Korean couple Shin Min-ah and Kim Woo-bin are set to get married in December. The couple has been dating since 2015.

Karan Johar hid voice training from father to avoid being called effeminate Karan Johar discussed his struggle with bullying due to his effeminate voice and mannerisms. He shared how secret voice coaching helped him cope amid lack of awareness and counselling in the 1980s.

The Raja Saab eyes North America domination with advance sales month before release Prabhas returns with 'The Raja Saab', a romantic horror-comedy set for a global release on January 9. With North American premieres on January 8, the film promises ghosts, thrills, romance and major festival excitement.

Sonam Kapoor announces second pregnancy in Princess Diana-inspired look Actor Sonam Kapoor is expecting her second child with husband Anand Ahuja. The actor shared the news on social media with stylish photos.

Sushmita Sen gets special birthday wish from Charu Asopa: Age bows down to you Charu Asopa shared a heartfelt birthday message for Sushmita Sen, lovingly calling her daughter Ziana's "sexy bua" and praising her beauty, wisdom, and grace. The post stood out among the many wishes the actor received as she celebrated her birthday on November 19.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa's Homebound to release on Netflix tomorrow Homebound, India's official Oscar entry, will stream on Netflix from November 21. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film stars Vishal Jethwa, Ishaan Khatter and Janhvi Kapoor.

Mastiii 4: Censor board cuts animal sex scene, words 'behen' and item replaced 'Mastiii 4' received an A certificate after the Central Board of Film Certification required a set of limited cuts and changes to dialogue and visuals. The film is headlined by Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh.

Kufar: Diljit Dosanjh's choreographers defend dance moves amid objectification row Choreographers of Diljit Dosanjh's recent track 'Kufar' addressed social media backlash over the song, citing intent behind dance moves and defending their artistic vision.

Why is Alia Bhatt missing from Dining With the Kapoors? Armaan Jain clarifies Alia Bhatt is missing from Netflix's 'Dining With the Kapoors'. The show's  due to work commitments. This absence has sparked curiosity among fans about the family gathering.

Keerthy Suresh breaks silence on her AI morphed images: It's hurting, irritating Actor Keerthy Suresh shared her concern over AI-generated altered images of herself circulating online, expressing emotional distress and highlighting broader challenges posed by artificial intelligence.

Arjun Rampal refuses to explain Dhurandhar torture scene: Won't talk about that The trailer for upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' drew attention for its graphic violence and cast revelations during its Mumbai launch event. Arjun Rampal addressed a question about the violent scene in the trailer featuring him, but didn't really address it.

Perfect Family trailer: Humorous yet emotional take on therapy and family dynamics The trailer of Perfect Family, India's first paid YouTube long-format series, has been released. The show, produced by Pankaj Tripathi, promises a humorous yet emotional take on family therapy and mental health stigma.

Karan Johar on his need for love: You get loneliest in your highs, not your lows Karan Johar opened up on Sania Mirza's podcast about feeling lonely despite accepting his singlehood, admitting he once deeply longed for companionship. The filmmaker said he would still embrace love "with arms wide like Shah Rukh Khan's" if it ever came his way.

general news.headline: Intellectuals turning terrorists more dangerous, Supreme Court told in riots caseDelhi police said a trend has emerged where intellectuals were using state funding to become doctors and engineers and then engage in anti-national activities. The Supreme Court was hearing the bail pleas of activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam.

Hope new government...: What Tejashwi Yadav said in 1st remarks since Bihar lossTejashwi Yadav, who has been surprisingly mum on the Mahagathbandhan's Bihar loss, broke silence with a congratulatory post for Nitish Kumar on taking oath for the 10th time.

PM Modi's call, nuclear dust over LA, 350% tariff in Trump's new India-Pak claimRepeating the claim for the nth time, Trump said he settled the conflict between India and Pakistan after threatening the two countries with 350% tariffs. He also claimed that PM Modi called him to say India was not going to war.

Fresh Gen-Z protests erupt in Nepal, curfew imposed in Bara districtRestrictions are in effect from 1 pm to 8 pm local time, citing concerns over public safety amid a rapidly intensifying youth-driven movement that entered its second consecutive day.

120 Bahadur review: Farhan Akhtar-led war drama salutes bravery but lacks impactRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025120 Bahadur movie review: '120 Bahadur' attempts to honour the bravery of soldiers at Rezang La during the 1962 Indo-China war. Despite sincere performances and stunning visuals, the film falls short of delivering a deeply moving war drama.

The Hooghly googly: Why BJP hits a wall in West BengalPM Modi might use the Ganga metaphor to talk about an electoral victory in Bengal after Bihar, but geography itself throws up a Hooghly googly. On the demographic back foot in West Bengal, the BJP's problem is how does it dislodge Mamata Banerjee, who hasn't lodged herself as the CM even after 14 years, playing the eternal opposition to a "scheming Dilli"?

Can't impose timelines on Governors for bills, says Supreme Court, with a riderThe Supreme Court said that Governors cannot sit on Bills indefinitely, even as it was not in favour of fixed timelines for granting assent. While highlighting the separation of powers, the court said prolonged delays in clearing Bills could still be subjected to judicial scrutiny.

Pakistan is building a new island. It is because of TrumpPakistan news: Months after US President Donald Trump showed interest in the country's 'massive oil reserves', surprising not just industry experts but Pakistan itself, Islamabad is building an artificial island to ramp up oil and gas exploration.

Why the viral Raulane photos turned into a nightmare for the photographersTheir photos spread like wildfire, introducing a little-known village festival to the world. But instead of feeling proud, the photographers stayed up night after night, fighting for the one thing that should've come easily: credit.

Don't do drama, won't make a difference, teacher told Delhi boy before suicideIn his suicide note, the class 10 student blamed his school teachers for mentally harassing him for several years and urged his family to donate his organs to those in need.

Sunjay Kapur's sister says he never treated Karisma badly, just had a bad divorceMandhira Kapur opens up about the family's legal battles and emotional turmoil after Sunjay Kapur's death, addressing claims involving her brother's divorce with actor Karisma Kapoor.
I'm a doctor going through perimenopause, and here's exactly how I'm managing itA dermatologist's first-hand journey through the science, skin, and soul of hormonal change - perimenopause.

Money Heist in Bengaluru: CCTV shows gang doing recce before Rs 7 crore robberyPolice probing the Rs 7 crore cash van robbery in Bengaluru have identified a suspect by matching CCTV footage with past records. Investigators believe the same gang is linked to earlier ATM robbery cases. A citywide manhunt is underway.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

ED files chargesheet against Robert Vadra in Sanjay Bhandari black money caseThe case stems from 2016 raids that uncovered documents suggesting coordination over a London property and related financial dealings. Vadra has denied the allegations, calling the probe politically motivated.

Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for record 10th time, PM presentNitish Kumar was sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th time at Patna's Gandhi Maidan, with PM Modi and several NDA Chief Ministers in attendance.

Indian seafood a great hit in China as Beijing takes on TokyoIndian seafood exports to China have been rising amid Beijing's clampdown on imports from Japan. Beijing on Wednesday imposed a complete ban on Japanese seafood imports amid a diplomatic battle over Taiwan. Shares of Indian seafood exporters surged soon after, pointing towards potential gains for the sector, which was hit by steep US tariffs.

Prashant Kishor's silence contrasts Gandhi Maidan noise on Bihar Day 1While JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar was sworn in as Bihar CM amid slogans, cheers and political fanfare at Patna's Gandhi Maidan, Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor, whose party drew a nil, marked the day with silence at the Gandhi Ashram in West Champaran. PK is seeking to position himself as a new kind of opposition, which is focused on accountability and collective action.

Mamdani is Indian, says Mehdi Hasan, rips apart Eric Trump as dumbest of dumb sonsBritish-American journalist Mehdi Hasan slammed Eric Trump for alleging that New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani "hates" Indians. Hasan reminded Eric that Mamdani has Indian heritage, saying that's why he is the dumbest of the dumb sons.

Who's Leshi Singh? Nitish minister, who defeated two Purnia MPs at one goAmong the three women in Nitish Kumar's 27-member Cabinet, Leshi Singh is the six-time MLA from Purnia's Dhamdaha who has made the seat her own. In the 2025 Bihar Assembly election, Leshi Singh defeated the combined force of two Purnia MPs—one former (Santosh Kushwaha), one incumbent (Pappu Yadav)—to win with a commanding margin.

Foreign tourists' Chunari Chunari dance at Rajasthan petrol pump is a superhit videoIt all began when the driver of a tractor parked at the petrol pump turned up the volume on Chunari Chunari. The desi beats delighted the foreign tourists, who couldn't resist breaking into an impromptu dance.

Will Shubman Gill play Guwahati Test? India batting coach gives updateIndia batting coach Sithanshu Kothak said that a call on Shubman gill's participation for the Guwahati Test will be made on the eve of the match. Gill's fitness continues to be monitored as he was absent for most of the Kolkata Test.

Is interstellar comet 3I/Atlas an alien spaceship? Nasa breaks silenceThe comet, discovered on July 1, 2025, has sparked unprecedented interest, prompting Nasa to coordinate a solar system-wide observation campaign.

Al-Falah alumnus involved in 2 blasts in 2008: Delhi blast probe uncovers linkAuthorities investigating the November 10 car blast near Delhi's Red Fort have discovered a connection to Mirza Shadab Baig, an alumnus of Al-Falah University, who was previously involved in the 2008 Delhi and Ahmedabad blasts.

sports.headline: Australian Open: Satwik-Chirag and Shetty advance, HS Prannoy bows out Ayush Shetty progressed to the Australian Open quarterfinals with a straight-games victory over World No.9 Kodai Naraoka, while top-seeded Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty also secured their place in the last eight. HS Prannoy's early exit continued his disappointing run this season.

England's performance in Ashes 2025 will define their progress: Brendon McCullum England head coach Brendon McCullum believes that their performance in the upcoming Ashes tour will define how far this team has come.

Some people have agendas: India batting coach defends Gambhir over Eden remarks India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak strongly defends head coach Gautam Gambhir amid criticism over the Eden Gardens pitch. Kotak suggests criticism is driven by individual agendas and calls it unfair to Gambhir.

Will Shubman Gill play Guwahati Test? India batting coach gives update India batting coach Sithanshu Kothak said that a call on Shubman gill's participation for the Guwahati Test will be made on the eve of the match. Gill's fitness continues to be monitored as he was absent for most of the Kolkata Test.

Feel like a champion: Sanju Samson dons CSK's yellow jersey ahead of IPL 2026 Sanju Samson has finally donned the iconic Chennai Super Kings yellow, and the India wicketkeeper-batter says the moment feels every bit as surreal and powerful as he had imagined over the years.

England captain Ben Stokes desperate to win Ashes in Australia: Our chance at history Ben Stokes has said that he is desperate to join the elite list of England captains who have won an Ashes in Australia, ahead of the first Test in Perth. Stokes has been a key player in the Ashes over the past few years.

Steve Smith recalls Panesar's embarrassing quiz show after sandpaper sledge Ashes: Steve Smith has responded to Monty Panesar's sandpaper sledge by recalling the former England spinner's awkward appearance on a British quiz show, adding early spice to the build up to the first Test in Perth.

Arshad Nadeem yet to get over World Athletics Championships disappointment Paris Olympics Champion Arshad Nadeem said that he is yet to get over his poor performance during the World Athletics Championship in Tokyo earlier this year. Nadeem got eliminated early as he struggled during the four throws he put in during the final.

Former Pakistan captain Azhar Ali resigns from PCB selection panel Former Pakistan captain Azhar Ali has resigned from his roles in the Pakistan Cricket Board's selection committee and youth development setup. His decision comes in the wake of Sarfaraz Ahmed being handed full control of the Pakistan Shaheens and Under-19 teams.

No 2.5 day lottery, Gill replacement: Chopra on India's to-do list for 2nd Test Aakash Chopra has revealed what India will need to do ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati. Chopra also named the player that India should use to replace Shubman Gill in the lineup.

Cadillac F1 not going to settle for a long-term back-grid role, says Graeme Lowdon Graeme Lowdon says Cadillac F1 will enter the 2026 season focused on execution and rapid development, insisting the new team has no intention of settling into a long-term back-grid position despite the challenges of joining Formula One.

Cristiano Ronaldo thanks Trump after getting golden key at White House dinnerPortugal superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has thanked United States President Donald Trump for inviting him to the White House, where he was presented with a symbolic golden key.

Manoj Tiwary questions BCCI selectors over lack of communication with Mohammed ShamiManoj Tiwary has criticised the BCCI selectors for poor communication regarding Mohammed Shami's exclusion from the Indian team, questioning why a senior pacer was not directly consulted despite his strong domestic performances.

Gambhir having a go at India players with his Eden pitch remarks: AB de VilliersFormer South Africa captain AB de Villiers believes Gautam Gambhir indirectly criticised the Indian players after the Eden Gardens Test defeat, saying the coach's remarks on the pitch hinted at dissatisfaction with the team's batting.

SC-appointed Justice Rao calls for AIFF reforms to revive ISL biddingJustice (Retd) L Nageswara Rao, in his report to the Supreme Court, has recommended striking a balance between preserving the autonomy of the All India Football Federation (AIFF) and safeguarding the commercial interests of prospective bidders, following the unsuccessful tender process to monetise India's top football league.

Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim becomes 11th batter to score hundred in his 100th TestBAN vs IRE: Mushfiqur Rahim slammed a century on his 100th Test match as the veteran wicketkeeper-batter continues to make history for Bangladesh's Test team.

Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif in trouble for criticising Mohsin Naqvi's PCBPakistan's cybercrime agency has launched a probe against former captain Rashid Latif over his comments criticising the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) and its chief Mohsin Naqvi for frequently changing the national team's captains.

Australia name playing XI for 1st Test, hand debuts to Weatherald and DoggetAshes: Australia handed Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett their Test debuts in the Perth opener. Weatherald is expected to walk out alongside Usman Khawaja at the top of the order, while Doggett comes in as the third pacer.

Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim becomes 11th batter to score hundred in his 100th TestBAN vs IRE: Mushfiqur Rahim slammed a century on his 100th Test match as the veteran wicketkeeper-batter continues to make history for Bangladesh's Test team.

Weatherald is expected to walk out alongside Usman Khawaja at the top of the order, while Doggett comes in as the third pacer.

PSG defender Achraf Hakimi crowned African Footballer of the YearParis Saint-Germain and Morocco defender Achraf Hakimi has been named African Footballer of the Year after a treble-winning season, leading a night of Moroccan dominance at the CAF Awards in Rabat.

Gambhir era turning pitches: The great leveller for visiting spinnersIndia's recent loss in Kolkata has once again laid bare their frailties against spin on vicious turning tracks. Over the past 12 months, there has been a major shift in power with regard to visiting spinners in India, who have finally seemed to crack the code on how to tame Indian batters on their home soil.

Ashes: Can Joe Root conquer the Australia frontier to silence critics?Ashes 2025: Joe Root has yet to score a Test century in Australia, and he will be aiming to conquer this final frontier when the five-match Ashes series begins on November 21 at Perth Stadium. England have not won an Ashes Test in Australia since 2011.

Rafael Nadal back on court 12 months after retirement, practises with ex-studentA year after retiring, Rafael Nadal returned to the court to practice with rising star Alexandra Eala, celebrating her rapid rise in tennis while sharing a joyful moment with his former academy student.

Harbhajan Singh shakes hands with Pakistan bowler in Abu Dhabi T10 league, see picsFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh shook hands with Pakistan's Shahnawaz Dahani during the Abu Dhabi T10 League after his team's narrow loss to Northern Warriors at the Zayed Cricket Stadium.

Enough of experiments, India need stability to revive Test cricket: Manoj TiwaryFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary feels that the current team need to bring back stability in their Test squad to rise above recent losses. India lost the first Test against South Africa by 30 runs and are in danger of losing their 2nd successive series at home.

Shubman Gill in doubt for ODI series, set to miss 2nd Test vs South Africa: SourcesIND vs SA, 2nd Test: Shubman Gill is unlikely to make the cut for the Guwahati Test due to a neck injury that he sustained in the series opener at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata and might also end up missing the ODI series.

Virat, Rohit wanted to save Test cricket but quit due to bad atmosphere: TiwaryFormer cricketer Manoj Tiwary claims Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were forced to retire from Test cricket due to a poor team environment. Both stalwarts announced their retirement from the longest format earlier this year ahead of the England tour.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
